radiographic_examinations.findings: There is subsegmental bilateral lower lobe dependent atelectasis. There is also mild right middle lobe atelectasis. The heart is mild to moderately enlarged. There is a trace pericardial effusion, likely physiologic. Mild central intrahepatic biliary duct dilatation is observed. There is a 1.9 x 1.4 cm intermediate density versus enhancing nodule within the body of the left adrenal gland and a similar right adrenal lesion measuring up to 1.8 x 1.5 cm. Extensive wall thickening throughout the sigmoid colon with surrounding vascular injection and fat stranding. A 4.4 x 2.5 x 4.1 cm mildly rim enhancing fluid collection concerning for an abscess. No air within the endometrial canal. Small quantity of free fluid within the lower abdomen. Negative for free air in the abdomen. The left ovary is enlarged; the right ovary is not definitively identified. No osseous lesions concerning for infection or malignancy. Degenerative changes are seen throughout the imaged spine, most severe at L5-S1.
